Author: liquid_nitrogenn
Text: In the inpatient/hospital setting, dietitians use the Harris-Benedict equation to determine caloric needs. I'm currently on an NJ tube (outpatient) receiving enteral feeds, and they use that equation to determine my maintenance calories, and yes, it's accurate.  The equation requires height and weight to calculate BMR and then you multiply based on activity level. It's unlikely that at 1100 you're even reaching your BMR, which is just what your body would need to sustain you in a coma.  If you're interested, here's a Harris-Benedict calorie calculator:  https://manytools.org/handy/bmr-calculator/  Please try to take care of yourself, I know how hard it is but your brain and body both need nourishment ðŸ’•
